title: Story Continuation Engine
description: Continue existing stories with consistent style, character development, and plot progression
author: Prompt Forge Pro

fields.label: Current POV Character
fields.placeholder: e.g., Sarah (protagonist), Marcus (antagonist)
fields.helpText: Whose perspective is the story currently told from?

fields.label: Existing Story Excerpt
fields.placeholder: Paste the last few paragraphs or pages of your story here...
fields.helpText: Include enough context for smooth continuation

fields.label: Main Characters
fields.placeholder: e.g., Sarah Chen (scientist, protagonist), Dr. Valdez (mentor), Alex (love interest)
fields.helpText: List key characters with brief descriptions

fields.label: Character Arcs in Progress
fields.placeholder: e.g., Sarah overcoming fear of leadership, Alex learning to trust
fields.helpText: What character development is currently happening?

fields.label: Relationship Dynamics
fields.placeholder: e.g., Sarah and Alex growing closer, tension between Sarah and Dr. Valdez
fields.helpText: How are character relationships evolving?

fields.label: Character Motivations
fields.placeholder: e.g., Sarah wants to save her sister, Alex seeks redemption for past mistakes

fields.label: Current Plot Point
fields.placeholder: e.g., Just discovered the conspiracy, about to enter the dangerous facility
fields.helpText: Where is the story right now?

fields.label: Next Plot Development
fields.placeholder: e.g., Confrontation with the antagonist, major revelation about the mystery
fields.helpText: What should happen next in the plot?

fields.label: Primary Conflict/Tension
fields.placeholder: e.g., Race against time, moral dilemma, external threat

fields.label: Foreshadowing Elements
fields.placeholder: e.g., Hints about Sarah's hidden past, setup for the final battle
fields.helpText: What future events should be subtly hinted at?

fields.label: Setting Details
fields.placeholder: e.g., Underground research facility, futuristic city, 1920s Paris

fields.label: World Rules/Magic System
fields.placeholder: e.g., Technology limitations, magic system rules, social hierarchies
fields.helpText: Important rules that govern your story world

fields.label: Atmosphere
fields.placeholder: e.g., Tense and claustrophobic, magical and whimsical, gritty and realistic

fields.label: Time Period/Era
fields.placeholder: e.g., 2087, Medieval Europe, 1960s America

fields.label: Writing Style Notes
fields.placeholder: e.g., Concise and punchy, lyrical and descriptive, dialogue-heavy
fields.helpText: Describe the established writing style

fields.label: Dialogue Style
fields.placeholder: e.g., Realistic and natural, witty banter, formal period speech
fields.helpText: How do characters speak in your story?

fields.label: Thematic Elements
fields.placeholder: e.g., Identity and belonging, power and corruption, love vs. duty
fields.helpText: What themes is your story exploring?

fields.label: Emotional Journey
fields.placeholder: e.g., From despair to hope, growing confidence, facing fears
fields.helpText: What emotional journey should characters experience?

fields.label: Plot Advancement Goals
fields.placeholder: e.g., Reveal key information, create new obstacles, move toward climax

fields.label: Character Growth Focus
fields.placeholder: e.g., Sarah learns to trust her instincts, Alex faces his past
fields.helpText: How should characters grow in this section?

fields.label: Specific Scenes to Include
fields.placeholder: e.g., Emotional conversation between Sarah and Alex, action sequence in the lab
fields.helpText: Any particular scenes you want included

fields.label: Elements to Avoid
fields.placeholder: e.g., No graphic violence, avoid cliche romance tropes, don't kill off characters
fields.helpText: What should be avoided in the continuation?

title: Character Development Engine
description: Create rich, complex characters with detailed backgrounds, motivations, and arcs
author: Prompt Forge Pro

fields.label: Character Name
fields.placeholder: e.g., Elena Rodriguez

fields.label: Gender
fields.placeholder: e.g., Female, Male, Non-binary

fields.label: Occupation/Role
fields.placeholder: e.g., Forensic scientist, Former military, Student

fields.label: Physical Description
fields.placeholder: e.g., 5'6", athletic build, dark hair often in ponytail, observant green eyes
fields.helpText: Focus on distinctive features and overall appearance

fields.label: Personality Type
fields.helpText: Myers-Briggs personality type for psychological foundation

fields.label: Core Personality Traits
fields.placeholder: e.g., Analytical, loyal, stubborn, compassionate, perfectionist
fields.helpText: List 3-5 defining traits

fields.label: Quirks and Habits
fields.placeholder: e.g., Always carries a notebook, taps fingers when thinking, quotes movies
fields.helpText: Small behaviors that make the character memorable

fields.label: Speaking Style
fields.placeholder: e.g., Direct and precise, uses technical terms, speaks softly
fields.helpText: How does this character talk?

fields.label: Core Motivation
fields.placeholder: e.g., Seeking justice for her father's death, proving herself worthy
fields.helpText: What drives this character above all else?

fields.label: Greatest Fear
fields.placeholder: e.g., Being helpless to protect loved ones, failure in crucial moments

fields.label: Deepest Desire
fields.placeholder: e.g., To feel truly understood, to make a lasting difference

fields.label: Internal Conflict
fields.placeholder: e.g., Wants justice but struggles with vengeance, needs help but fears trust
fields.helpText: What internal struggle drives character growth?

fields.label: Defense Mechanisms
fields.placeholder: e.g., Uses humor to deflect emotion, becomes overly analytical under stress
fields.helpText: How does the character protect themselves emotionally?

fields.label: Backstory Summary
fields.placeholder: e.g., Grew up in military family, lost father in suspicious accident, excelled in forensics
fields.helpText: Key background events that shaped the character

fields.label: Formative Experience
fields.placeholder: e.g., Witnessed injustice at age 12, first solved a mystery in college
fields.helpText: Single most important experience that shaped who they are

fields.label: Family Background
fields.placeholder: e.g., Close to mother, distant from siblings, idolized father
fields.helpText: Family relationships and their influence

fields.label: Education/Training
fields.placeholder: e.g., PhD in Forensic Science, Military training, Self-taught hacker
fields.helpText: Formal and informal learning that affects skills

fields.label: Significant Relationships
fields.placeholder: e.g., Best friend from college, mentor at work, complicated relationship with ex
fields.helpText: Important people in their life and relationship status

fields.label: Character Arc Starting Point
fields.placeholder: e.g., Isolated and distrustful, overconfident in abilities
fields.helpText: Where does the character begin emotionally/psychologically?

fields.label: Character Journey
fields.placeholder: e.g., Learning to trust others, accepting help, finding balance
fields.helpText: What will the character learn/overcome?

fields.label: Growth Challenges
fields.placeholder: e.g., Must work with team, confront past trauma, make moral choices
fields.helpText: What obstacles will force character growth?

fields.label: Transformation Goal
fields.placeholder: e.g., From loner to team player, from revenge-seeker to justice-bringer
fields.helpText: How should the character be different by the end?

fields.label: Arc Resolution
fields.placeholder: e.g., Finds peace with father's death, embraces new family
fields.helpText: How does the character arc conclude?

fields.label: Story Genre
fields.helpText: Genre affects character development approach

fields.label: Plot Function
fields.placeholder: e.g., Solves the central mystery, creates complications, provides expertise
fields.helpText: What role does this character play in advancing the plot?

fields.label: Thematic Purpose
fields.placeholder: e.g., Represents the cost of obsession, shows power of forgiveness
fields.helpText: What themes does this character embody or explore?

fields.label: Key Story Relationships
fields.placeholder: e.g., Mentors rookie detective, romantic tension with partner, conflicts with boss
fields.helpText: Important relationships within the story

fields.label: Trust Patterns
fields.placeholder: e.g., Trusts too easily, takes time to open up, tests people first
fields.helpText: How does this character approach trust?

fields.label: Love Language
fields.helpText: How does this character express and receive love?

fields.label: Specific Scene Requirements
fields.placeholder: e.g., Must have breakdown scene, confrontation with villain, moment of triumph
fields.helpText: Any specific scenes this character must be part of

fields.label: Character Flaws/Weaknesses
fields.placeholder: e.g., Impatient, prideful, self-sacrificing to a fault
fields.helpText: What flaws make this character human and create story conflicts?

title: World Building Architect

fields.label: Time Period/Era
fields.placeholder: e.g., Medieval-inspired, 2087, Victorian era, Post-apocalyptic

fields.label: Primary Setting

fields.label: Ecosystem/Wildlife

fields.label: Cultural Values

fields.label: Political Climate
